abstract: In just over six months, New York City has gone from being the home of the five largest, free-standing investment banks in the country to being on the verge of having none. The last two, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, announced on Sunday that they would transform themselves into more conventional banking companies, like Bank of America or Wachovia.
lead_paragraph: In just over six months, New York City has gone from being the home of the five largest, free-standing investment banks in the country to being on the verge of having none. The last two, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, announced on Sunday that they would transform themselves into more conventional banking companies, like Bank of America or Wachovia.

headline.main: Experts See a More Subdued Period Ahead for New York’s Economy
